title: Elegant Font and Funky Font
content:
Can anyone identify these fonts? Thanks:

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [cocolulutplogovr6.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/typophile.com/files/cocolulutplogovr6.gif) | 2.02 KB |
| [cecil\_logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/typophile.com/files/cecil_logo.gif) | 2.69 KB |
| [nuts\_banner0802.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/typophile.com/files/nuts_banner0802.png) | 5.56 KB |
| [LIZ01.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/typophile.com/files/LIZ01.jpg) | 163.34 KB |

 [‹ PLease help, Cyrillic & Greek version or alternative of Cachet](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40787 "Go to previous forum topic") [Chunky serif type on Focus magazine, Sweden ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40784 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Deluxee

comments.content: “CECIL” is similar to [Poliphilus](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/poliphilus/) or some other Bembo look-a-like garalde...

I found a digital version of the font used in “LIZ LISA” that’s called [Koster](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typotheticals/koster/), but it’s not an exact match...

Some more on the Koster font:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/17300](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17300 "http://www.typophile.com/node/17300")  
 [http://www.typophile.com/node/850](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.typophile.com/node/850 "http://www.typophile.com/node/850")

Thanks!

Does anyone know this one?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ALB01_6671.png)

That look’s lika a [Fritz Quadrata](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Friz+Quadrata&x=0&y=0) with added swashes. Probably custom. I never heard of a Fritz Quadrata with alternates or swashes? Anyone?

BTW: You should have started a new thread for this one...
[ID’d by Lars](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=106579) 3 days ago on MyFonts’ WTF as Novarese Bold.

Aha! That’s it. In my deffence; That was a way better sample... ;^)

BTW: Is there really any difference between the UC’s in [Novarese Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-novarese/bold/) and [Novarese Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122114409/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-novarese/bold-italic/)?
